intro: Mollinedia nigrescens, commonly known as the black-stemmed mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
